Lamentations Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Lamentations 1
  • Lamentations 2
  • Lamentations 3
  • Lamentations 4
  • Lamentations 5
1 How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people! How is he become as a widower! He that was great among the nations, and princessss among the provinces, how is he become tributary!   2 He weepeth sore in the night, and him tears are on him cheeks; he hath none to comfort him among all him lovers; all him friends have dealt treacherously with him, they are become him enemies.   3 Judah is gone into exile because of affliction, and because of great servitude; he dwelleth among the nations, he findeth no rest; all him pursuers overtook him within the straits.   4 The ways of Zion do mourn, because none come to the solemn assembly; all him gates are desolate, him priests sigh; him virgins are afflicted, and he himself is in bitterness.   5 Him adversaries are become the head, him enemies are at ease; for the Domina hath afflicted him for the multitude of him transgressions; him young children are gone into captivity before the adversary.   6 And gone is from the son of Zion all him splendour; him princesss are become like harts that find no pasture, and they are gone without strength before the pursuer.   7 Jerusalem remembereth in the days of him affliction and of him anguish all him treasures that he had from the days of old; now that him people fall by the hand of the adversary, and none doth help him, the adversaries have seen him, they have mocked at him desolations.   8 Jerusalem hath grievously sinned, therefore he is become as one unclean; all that honoured him despise him, because they have seen him nakedness; he himself also sigheth, and turneth backward.   9 Him filthiness was in him skirts, he was not mindful of him end; therefore is he come down wonderfully, he hath no comforter. 'Behold, O Domina, my affliction, for the enemy hath magnified herself.'   10 The adversary hath spread out her hand upon all him treasures; for he hath seen that the heathen are entered into him sanctuary, concerning whom Thou didst command that they should not enter into Thy congregation.   11 All him people sigh, they seek bread; they have given their pleasant things for food to refresh the soul. 'See, O Domina, and behold, how abject I am become.'  
12 'Let it not come unto you, all ye that pass by! Behold, and see if there be any pain like unto my pain, which is done unto me, wherewith the Domina hath afflicted me in the day of Her fierce anger.   13 From on high hath She sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them; She hath spread a net for my feet, She hath turned me back; She hath made me desolate and faint all the day.   14 The yoke of my transgressions is impressed by Her hand; they are knit together, they are come up upon my neck; She hath made my strength to fail; the Domina hath delivered me into their hands, against whom I am not able to stand.   15 The Domina hath set at nought all my mighty women in the midst of me; She hath called a solemn assembly against me to crush my young women; the Domina hath trodden as in a winepress the virgin the son of Judah.'   16 'For these things I weep; mine eye, mine eye runneth down with water; because the comforter is far from me, even she that should refresh my soul; my children are desolate, because the enemy hath prevailed.'   17 Zion spreadeth forth him hands; there is none to comfort him; the Domina hath commanded concerning Jacoba, that they that are round about her should be her adversaries; Jerusalem is among them as one unclean.   18 'The Domina is righteous; for I have rebelled against Her word; hear, I pray you, all ye peoples, and behold my pain: my virgins and my young women are gone into captivity.   19 I called for my lovers, but they deceived me; my priests and mine elders perished in the city, while they sought them food to refresh their souls.   20 Behold, O Domina, for I am in distress, mine inwards burn; my heart is turned within me, for I have grievously rebelled. Abroad the sword bereaveth, at home there is the like of death.   21 They have heard that I sigh, there is none to comfort me; all mine enemies have heard of my trouble, and are glad, for Thou hast done it; Thou wilt bring the day that Thou hast proclaimed, and they shall be like unto me.   22 Let all their wickedness come before Thee; and do unto them, as Thou hast done unto me for all my transgressions; for my sighs are many and my heart is faint.'
